alert.note: Alert for Broward; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 3:36PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen during the last hour over this area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area during the next couple of hours with these slow moving thunderstorms. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Margate, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By- The-Sea, Coconut Creek, Oakland Park, North Lauderdale, Parkland, Hillsboro Beach, Sea Ranch Lakes, Boca Pointe, Boca Del Mar, Godfrey Road, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Palm Aire and Mission Bay. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
